p: The second major pathway implicated in PD pathogenesis is mitochondrial metabolism, which is susceptible to damage by oxidative stress. A prevailing hypothesis is that mutations in PRKN and PINK1 cause PD due to mitochondrial dysfunction. Clinically, people with PRKN PD and PINK1 PD display an earlier-onset, are sensitive to levodopa, and are prone to motor fluctuations. And, Â these patients have minimal cognitive decline, even after many years of disease [ 13].
